In Trump's America, how great are you?

paragraphs.text: Hours before the ill-fated premiere — Jenner and her momager teased about the ad’s arrival by boasting the fact that this will be the first major collaboration between Pepsi and a supermodel since Cindy Crawford’s entry back in 1992.
paragraphs.name: ce33

paragraphs.text: Pepsi truly and deeply extends a heartfelt apology to all those who were offended by what was clearly a glaring lack in judgment. We pride ourselves as a company that always strives for excellence, and in the quest to maintain this mission, we misrepresented our best intentions, which regrettably has led to a dire misunderstanding at the expense of individuals and organizations that are heralded for their adherence to justice and the never ending quest for basic rights — for all.
paragraphs.name: f828
1fbd
paragraphs.text: Call me crazy but there is zero evidence that Kendall Jenner is globally impactful other than the fact that she is quite savvy at managing a ton of makeup and yards of tulle like a pro.
The worst part of this mess has to be the realization that Black Lives will most likely never Matter in my lifetime.
paragraphs.name: 02d1
241e
paragraphs.text: Pepsi remains firmly in support of those endeavors and will strive to prove that pledge through future actions. Again, we are terribly sorry and are truly remorseful about the outcome of our embarrassing actions.
The worst part of this mess has to be the realization that Black Lives will most likely never Matter in my lifetime.
paragraphs.name: 02d1

4ee360b14726.title: There wasn’t anything wrong with this ad, what’s wrong are these interpretations people are making…

paragraphs.text: There wasn’t anything wrong with this ad, what’s wrong are these interpretations people are making of it, construed by self-fulfilling pickings of what could be deemed as offensive. This ad does relate to the revolutions and protests we are having now, but not specifically is this depicted as a black lives matter protest. Kendall Jenner, like…
paragraphs.name: a053

9e20cb4de02b.title: Hmm. Interesting angle but a lot of assumptions and generalisations have been made.

paragraphs.text: Hmm. Interesting angle but a lot of assumptions and generalisations have been made. My post on the matter takes quite a different approach. Though I agree the advert trivialises the black lives matter movement I really do not think Pepsi were intentionally racist. And I really don’t know why we expect so much from that Kardashian-Jenner family, they will always prioritise money over morals.
paragraphs.name: 9fe1

47820b79cf00.title: I seem to recall Pepsi Co.

paragraphs.text: I seem to recall Pepsi Co. as having a quite remarkable diverse selection of executives with a woman at the helm. From the very beginning, when others have shied away, they’ve been outspoken against the corrupt modern day Jim Crowe regime engulfing the White House prompting uproar and boycott calls from Pepeworld. I actually can’t at the top of my…
paragraphs.name: 25bb

dbc4deee4188.title: I watched the ad the other day.

paragraphs.text: I watched the ad the other day. I was immediately appalled. It was so blatantly obvious that it would be offensive and IS offensive that I couldn’t understand why the hell it ever got past the “bad idea” pile on the whiteboard.

5bf284469b51.title: There was so much sickening about that commercial, yet it was sadly true too.

paragraphs.text: There was so much sickening about that commercial, yet it was sadly true too. One of the things that struck me was the fact that you had all of these people who clearly had no idea what they were actually protesting. People joining the protest with no idea what was being protested. Sadly, I think that is too common. I think that was the woman’s march…

5f14cab1cc64.title: Blacks make up approximately 13% of the US population while they commit 52% of crime.

paragraphs.text: Blacks make up approximately 13% of the US population while they commit 52% of crime. In 2014 according to the FBI, 90% of black homicide victims were killed by other black people.

paragraphs.text: I believe Pepsi knew what they were doing all along. In following the mantra of any publicity is good publicity they’ve clearly succeeded. Any apology to me would sound fake from a corporation like Pepsi.

ab872715c168.title: I think it’s interesting that Pepsi needs to apologize in a manner you want them to in order for it…

paragraphs.text: I think it’s interesting that Pepsi needs to apologize in a manner you want them to in order for it to truly be an apology. I remember once being told by a black activist that my belief that black lives matter rioting, looting, targeting whites for death, along with cops not being protesting was presumptuous in that I was believing that black lives…

paragraphs.text: BTW — I think you are justified in claiming that Jenner and Pepsi had profits in mind: that is what ad campaigns always care about…

e3c585803e72.title: What I find hilarious is that Pepsi have managed to piss off both the Right and the Left in one…

paragraphs.text: What I find hilarious is that Pepsi have managed to piss off both the Right and the Left in one fell swoop. The Left-wingers are offended because Pepsi appropriated their struggle. The Right-wingers are offended because Pepsi tried to sugarcoat Left-wing violence. We can’t agree on much, but we seem to agree that Pepsi’s ad department (or consultants) have no idea what they’re doing.
paragraphs.name: 4c2a

31f7f9de004f.title: Rates of reported child abuse are disproportionately high for black children.

paragraphs.text: Rates of reported child abuse are disproportionately high for black children. According to the Justice Department , black children ages 12 to 19 are “three times more likely to be victims of reported child abuse or neglect.” As many as 7,354 young people ages 12 to 24, most of them black, experience homelessness each year in D.C., and more than 2…
